text: Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 18 November 2011
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/66/L.5/Rev.1 and Add.1)]
Recalling all General Assembly resolutions on measures to eliminate international terrorism and Security Council resolutions on threats to international peace and security caused by terrorist acts,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* all {{General Assembly}} resolutions on measures to eliminate international terrorism and {{Security Council}} resolutions on threats to international peace and security caused by terrorist acts,

text: Reaffirming its resolutions 60/288 of 8 September 2006, 62/272 of 5 September 2008, 64/235 of 24 December 2009 and 64/297 of 8 September 2010 concerning the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its resolutions 60/288 of 8 September 2006, 62/272 of 5 September 2008, 64/235 of 24 December 2009 and 64/297 of 8 September 2010 concerning the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy,

text: Noting with appreciation the contribution agreement to launch the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre signed by the United Nations and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia on 19 September 2011,
textWithHighlights: *Noting with appreciation* the contribution agreement to launch the {{United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre}} signed by the {{United Nations}} and the {{Kingdom of Saudi Arabia}} on 19 September 2011,
uncertainties: Classified the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre (UNCCT) under UN Secretariat; while UNCCT is part of OCT, it is not explicitly listed among entities, so normalization to UNCCT may be considered an extension.

text: Welcomes the establishment of the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre at United Nations Headquarters;
textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the establishment of the {{United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre}} at United Nations Headquarters;

text: Also welcomes the decision of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia to fund for three years the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre established within the Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force Office, to be funded through voluntary contributions;
textWithHighlights: Also *welcomes* the decision of the {{Kingdom of Saudi Arabia}} to fund for three years the {{United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre}} established within the {{Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force Office}}, to be funded through voluntary contributions;
uncertainties: UNCCT and the CTITF Office are not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; normalized using their common abbreviations as UN Secretariat entities.

text: Notes that the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre will operate under the direction of the Secretary-General and will contribute to promoting the implementation of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy through the Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force;
textWithHighlights: *Notes* that the {{United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre}} will operate under the direction of the {{Secretary-General}} and will contribute to promoting the implementation of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy through the {{Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force}};

text: Encourages all Member States to collaborate with the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre in contributing to the implementation of its activities in support of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<all Member States>> to collaborate with the {{United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre}} in contributing to the implementation of its activities in support of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy;
uncertainties: Classified the United Nations Counter-Terrorism Centre (UNCCT) under UN Secretariat; although not listed explicitly, it is a UN entity under UNOCT.

text: Decides to review the implementation of the present resolution at its sixty-eighth session within the existing reporting and review framework of the fourth biennial review of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy.
